info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 11:46PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following waterways in Indiana...
Youngs Creek at Amity.
Buck Creek at Acton.
Big Blue River at Carthage.
.Excessive rainfall from repeated rounds of showers and thunderstorms, which will continue well into the weekend, is bringing up water levels on waterways across Indiana, including Youngs Creek, Buck Creek, and Big Blue River. Flood is expected to begin overnight. Moderate flooding is possible. Folks in the vicinity should keep aware of the flood waters as they rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Youngs Creek at Amity.
* WHEN...From late tonight until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Significant flooding in progress. Parks and some local roads are flooded by a foot or more of water. Agricultural flooding is noticeable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 10.1 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Saturday afternoon by around 300 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
